page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: Housing. A good deal of housing has been built within the last ten years in Nawton and Beadlam. Most of it has been infill. There is some council housing in the three villages but there is less and less rented housing available because owners are renting them out as holiday cottages or selling them to people who want them for that purpose. The cost of housing in these villages has risen sharply as retired people and professional people have moved into the area. Many barns and farm buildings have been converted into housing and villagers believe that this has helped to "tidy up the village".
